title: plotPlotR
text: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("AgDataNomad/plotPlotR")

title: plotPlotR
text: plotPlotR package developed provide R users involved field experiments create manipulate geo-spatial plot layouts experiments. package small handful functions perform QGIS like field plot creation manipulation can used extract values different types raster adding values plots create shapefiles etc. package particularly useful users working raster data generated UAVs users want associate non-spatial data plot data. core plotPlotR creation plot segments. obtained corner points Google Maps, Google Earth, GPS sensors farm machine GPS survey tool, able create plots easily using functions package. can also assign Run Range values plots can moved vertically horizontally account discrepancies. package provide user friendly functions deal field plot creation manipulation.

title: plotPlotR
text: strongly recommended use CRS meters. Function read_input_dat() way users read data futher processing using package. function help (enforce) users assign change CRS input data. may choose use epsg.io find appropriate CRS region. examples package uses CRS 28355, based Australia. familiar terminology used package. People familiar field operations may find terminology used arguments functions new. Please refer functions help menu reference information. examples contains terminology may familiar used extensively package. Run plots along tractor runs Range axis exp_length refers length experiment (length Runs) exp_width refers width experiment package doesn’t call user provide precise direction North, South, East, West case. , field experiments aligned one direction users may able precisely capture record information. Lot functions package uses relative terms like, , , left, right, top bottom. believe easier users understand use. Please refer documentation functions relative terms used.

title: plotPlotR
text: experiment layout purposes package rectangular grid layout, smaller rectangles plots. plots can represented position two axis, Run Range. Plots along direction tractor travel called Run plots axis called Range. experiments experiment length exp_length akin length Run experiment width exp_width referring length Range. exp_length measure plot length gap multiplied number ranges exp_width tractor wheel width multiplied number runs. run maximum number ranges vice versa. several practical reasons, cases, experiment length typically longer experiment width good make assumptions. may cases experiment part larger experiment, many fewer ranges runs, case experiment length might smaller experiment width. Run Range may terminology use. Rows, Runs, Row, Run, rowNo, runNo, row_Num, run_NUm aliases Runs encountered. Similarly Range, column, Column, col etc used alias. Tt hard deal many aliases, try consistent needed provide alias used experiment.
code: dat <- read_input_dat(cornersData, 4326, 28355)  corners_to_plots(sf_object = dat, #package includes cornersData                   exp_length = 80, #number of ranges multiplied by plot length including gaps                  exp_width = 24.2, #number of runs multiplied by tractor wheel width                  n_runs = 11, #total number of runs                  n_ranges = 20) #total number of ranges #> Simple feature collection with 220 features and 0 fields #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 654927.818803806 ymin: 6184366.13151054 xmax: 654957.435093851 ymax: 6184447.24382193 #> Projected CRS: GDA94 / MGA zone 55 #> First 10 features: #>                          geometry #> 1  POLYGON ((654933.5166066171... #> 2  POLYGON ((654935.7109632440... #> 3  POLYGON ((654937.9053198711... #> 4  POLYGON ((654940.0996764980... #> 5  POLYGON ((654942.2940331250... #> 6  POLYGON ((654944.4883897521... #> 7  POLYGON ((654946.6827463790... #> 8  POLYGON ((654948.8771030061... #> 9  POLYGON ((654951.0714596330... #> 10 POLYGON ((654953.2658162600...

title: plotPlotR
text: Read spatial data using read_input_dat() function Use corners_to_plots() make_plots() functions takes 4 corner coordinates plots centers respectively make plot boundaries Use AddRunRange() function add Run Range coordinates plot layout Use make_split_plots() make split plots regular plots Export plot layout shape file formats using write_output_obj() function Read help pages specific information different functions. Visit plotPlotR information, updates etc

title: Authors and Citation
text: Aswin Singaram Natarajan. Author, maintainer. Todd Collins. Author, contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Singaram Natarajan , Collins T (2024). plotPlotR: Field experiment plot creation, segmentation manipulation. R package version 0.3.0.9001, https://agdatanomad.github.io/plotPlotR/, https://github.com/AgDataNomad/plotPlotR.
code: @Manual{,   title = {plotPlotR: Field experiment plot creation, segmentation and manipulation},   author = {Aswin {Singaram Natarajan} and Todd Collins},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.3.0.9001, https://agdatanomad.github.io/plotPlotR/},   url = {https://github.com/AgDataNomad/plotPlotR}, }

title: plotPlotR
text: plotPlotR referring plot plotter package containing set functions create plot layouts field trial segments boundaries purposes extracting value plot adding new data plot. functions based implementation “sf” package R provides users set tools simple R users create manipulate plot boundaries. Users may familiar spatial data want functions can used easily, repeatedly automated way can use package. Agricultural research farm management increasingly becoming digital. Equipment used farm operations data collection often connected internet, satellites generates rich meta-data. meta-data potential become key research support tools generates new opportunity. plotPlotR takes GPS data connected devices manually collected coordinates rasters sources develop tools supports agricultural research farm management. Since spatial data talking , applications package extend beyond agriculture preserving biodiverstity, land management, soil conservation etc.

title: plotPlotR
text: can install development version plotPlotR GitHub :

title: plotPlotR
text: basic example shows create plot boundaries:
code: library(plotPlotR) ## A simple function to create plot layout with corner points from a csv file  cornersData # dataframe with 4 XY points corresponding to four corners of an experiment #>          X         Y id #> 1 148.6870 -34.47064  1 #> 2 148.6873 -34.47062  4 #> 3 148.6869 -34.46992  2 #> 4 148.6872 -34.46990  3  dat <- read_input_dat(cornersData, 4326, 28355) # Reading data and converting to unit M CRS  dat_plots <- corners_to_plots(dat, 80, 24.2, 11, 20)  dat_plots <- addRunRange(dat_plots, "BL", n_runs = 11, n_ranges = 20)  plot(dat_plots)

what: Add Run and Range values to a field experiment plots — addRunRange
title: Add Run and Range values to a field experiment plots — addRunRange
text: generating plot boundaries, functions allows users assign Run Range values. identify () run1_range1 value, assume standing Southern end experiment RUNS, facing North. Bottom close , Top away . Left left side Right right side.

title: Add Run and Range values to a field experiment plots — addRunRange
Add Run and Range values to a field experiment plots — addRunRange
text: sf_object sf object geometry type POLYGON MULTIPOLYGON run1_range1 Position Run 1 Range 1. take 4 different options. "TR","TL","BR","BL" denoting top right, top left, bottom right, bottom left respectively. n_runs Integer value. Number runs experiment n_ranges Integer value. Number ranges experiment

title: Add Run and Range values to a field experiment plots — addRunRange
text: sf object Run Range columns added.

title: Add Run and Range values to a field experiment plots — addRunRange
code: dat <- read_input_dat(cornersData, 4326)  dat_plot <- corners_to_plots(sf_object = dat,                       exp_length = 80, exp_width = 24.2,                       n_runs = 11, n_ranges = 20)  datplot_w_RR <- addRunRange(dat_plot, "BL", 11, 20)  plot(datplot_w_RR)

what: A data frame containing 4 XY coordinates and a id variable — cornersData
title: A data frame containing 4 XY coordinates and a id variable — cornersData
text: XY coordinates WGS84 EPSG:4326 field experiment Australia. Data originally recorded csv format.

title: A data frame containing 4 XY coordinates and a id variable — cornersData
A data frame containing 4 XY coordinates and a id variable — cornersData
text: data frame 4 rows 3 columns: X Longitude Y Latitude id id

what: Generating plots from four corner points — corners_to_plots
title: Generating plots from four corner points — corners_to_plots
text: functions takes sf object similar 4 corners field experiment, find center rotation angle, make new plots based parameters produces sf object geometry type MULTIPOLYGON.

title: Generating plots from four corner points — corners_to_plots
code: corners_to_plots(   sf_object,   exp_length,   exp_width,   n_runs,   n_ranges,   plot_length = NULL,   plot_width = NULL )

title: Generating plots from four corner points — corners_to_plots
text: sf_object sf object geometry 4 POINTS data frame four rows X,Y (Longitude Latitude) exp_length Total length experiment unit meter exp_width Total width experiment unit meter n_runs Number runs experiment, typically along shorter side experiment. n_ranges Number ranges experiment, typically along longer side experiment. plot_length OPTIONAL. Numeric value. Length plot meters plot_width OPTIONAL. Numeric value. Width plot meters

title: Generating plots from four corner points — corners_to_plots
text: sf object geometry MULTIPOLYGON n_runs X n_ranges features.

title: Generating plots from four corner points — corners_to_plots
text: Default plot dimensions set 90 custom plot size, use optional plot size plot width arguments Use `read_input_dat()` bring corners data

title: Generating plots from four corner points — corners_to_plots

title: Expand points — expand_points
code: dat <- read_input_dat(cornersData, 4326, 28355)  dat_expanded <- expand_points(dat, 5)  plot(dat) plot(dat_expanded, add = TRUE)

title: Make plots from points i.e. plot centers or use to adjust length and the width of plots in an existing plot layout — make_plots
Make plots from points i.e. plot centers or use to adjust length and the width of plots in an existing plot layout — make_plots
text: sf_obj sf object geometry type POINTS referring plot center POLYGONS plot_length Length individual plots plot_width Width individual plots

title: Make plots from points i.e. plot centers or use to adjust length and the width of plots in an existing plot layout — make_plots
text: sf object geometry type POLYGON CRS input sf_obj

title: Make plots from points i.e. plot centers or use to adjust length and the width of plots in an existing plot layout — make_plots
code: #reading a corner points data  dat <- read_input_dat(cornersData, 4326)  #Making a default plot grid using exp length and width, and using number of plots  dat_plots <- corners_to_plots(dat, 80, 24.2, 11, 20)  plot(dat_plots)   #Adjusting the size of the individual plots  adj_plots <- make_plots(dat_plots, 2.5, 1.2)  plot(adj_plots)

title: Create split plot centers — make_split_plots
text: Splitting single regular plot two three plots.

title: Create split plot centers — make_split_plots
text: sf_obj sf object shape file, shp geojson split_dist Numeric input meters indicating amount offset plot center use creating new plots. split_into Integer input, number new plots generate one plot, takes 1 2 plot_length Numeric input, Length plot meters. plot_width Numeric input, Width plot meters.

title: Create split plot centers — make_split_plots
text: sf object geometry POLYGON

title: Create split plot centers — make_split_plots
text: support type sowing seeder can sow one variety plot.

title: Create split plot centers — make_split_plots
code: dat <- read_input_dat(cornersData, 4326, 28355)  dat_plots <- corners_to_plots(dat, 80, 24.2, 11, 22)  dat_split_plots <- make_split_plots(dat_plots, plot_length = 3, plot_width = 0.75)  plot(dat_split_plots)

Move ranges in your field experiment horizontally or vertically — movePlotRanges
text: sf_obj sf object geometry POLYGON MULTIPOLYGON Run Range columns moveDirection Direction move reference Run 1 Range 1. Takes "", "", "left" "right" inputs. moveDistance Numeric value meters move rangeSelection Integer value vector subset ranges ranges. Default ranges.

title: Move ranges in your field experiment horizontally or vertically — movePlotRanges
text: sf object geometry POLYGON Run Range columns

title: Move ranges in your field experiment horizontally or vertically — movePlotRanges
text: Move distance unit meters Move direction relation position Run 1 Range 1 Move plots field experiment. unlikely tractor sowing affects entire Run almost never subset Ranges.

title: Move ranges in your field experiment horizontally or vertically — movePlotRanges
code: dat <- read_input_dat(cornersData, 4326, 28355) dat_plots <- corners_to_plots(dat, 80, 24.2, 11, 20) dat_plots_RR <- addRunRange(dat_plots, "BL", 11, 20)   moved_plots <- movePlotRanges(dat_plots_RR, "right", 1.2, c(1,3,9))  plot(moved_plots)

title: Move runs in your field experiment horizontally or vertically — movePlotRuns
code: dat <- read_input_dat(cornersData, 4326, 28355) dat_plots <- corners_to_plots(dat, 80, 24.2, 11, 20) dat_plots_RR <- addRunRange(dat_plots, "BL", 11, 20)  moved_plots <- movePlotRuns(dat_plots_RR, "up", 4, c(3,7))  plot(moved_plots)

text: sf_object MULTIPOLYGON sf object, representing plot layouts field experiment. rotation_angle numerical value. Rotation angle degrees. Positive negative values accepted. selection character string value "plots" "experiment". "Plots" rotates individual plots center, "exp" rotates entire experiment.
